content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

```julia
immutable FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, string(fwu.value), " ", fwu.unit)
end
```

This `show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct takes an IO stream (`io`) and a `FloatWithUnits` object (`fwu`) as input arguments. Within the function, we concatenate the value field (`fwu.value`) and unit field (`fwu.unit`) with a space between them using string interpolation. This ensures that when this struct is printed or displayed, it will appear in the desired format "1.8 meters".
